summary: Comfortable user-definable dialog-boxes for use in GVIM and some other goodies
name: VDLGBX.DLL
description: Allows to compose and use arbitrary dialog boxes within your scripts. Features: * simple textfield * password-field * checkboxes * listboxes * comboboxes HTML-authoring-support: Create an -Tag out from simple the filename Translate foreign chars to HTML-entities (eg. Ã¤ -> &aauml;) Color-choosing Allows to choose a color (using the standard windows-dialog) and returns the RGB-values in whatever format you want (so far an arbitrary printf-formatstring can do it...)
install_details:
Copy VDLGBX.DLL into the runtime-folder (eg. vim61).
Read and execute VDLGBX.VIM - it's both a documentation and testing run.

versions.release_notes:
New Feature:
COLOR: Get RGB-values from standard color-choosing-dialog in (almost) any format you like

Some bugs fixed. 
New features: 
Passwordfield, HTML-Translate
